buck.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a US, Canadian, or Australian dollar
make a fast/quick buck (=make some money quickly, often dishonestly)
buck.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The movie is about a group of men trying to make a buck  (=earn some money) as male strippers.
Using celebrities in advertising is guaranteed to pull in big bucks.
buck.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a male rabbit, deer, and some other male animals
buck.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: if a horse bucks, it kicks its back feet into the air, or jumps with all four feet off the ground
buck.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to suddenly move up and down, or backwards and forwards, in an uncontrolled way
buck.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to oppose something in a direct way
buck.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: He was a rebel who bucked the system  (=opposed rules or authority).
Unemployment in the area has bucked the trend by falling over the last month.
Initially, he had bucked against her restraints.
buck.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: to make someone feel more happy, confident, or healthy
buck.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: He was bucked by the success he’d had.
She gave me a tonic which bucked me a little.
buck.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: I owe 500 bucks but I haven’t paid yet.
I hope that you guys can make a buck (=earn some money) out of it.
There are big bucks (=a lot of money) to be made from sport.
We won’t sacrifice investments in research and development for the sake of a fast buck (=money that you can make quickly and easily).
buck.translation[4].definitions[0].defin: to do something that goes against the rules or against the normal way of doing something
buck.translation[4].definitions[0].examp: Those who try to buck the system tend to miss out on promotion.
buck.translation[4].definitions[1].defin: to do well in business when other companies are doing badly
buck.translation[4].definitions[1].examp: Britain will buck the global recessionary trend next year with growth of around 1.1pc.
